entry.sense: ma for the interrogative maA immediately following a prep.: see maA in the Ṣ, Ḳ; and UilaI last sentence.
mi for mino: see an ex., from a poet, voce rub-a.
mu Qll-ehi, &c.: see Oayomunu Qll-ehi.
m- for Oum-: see the latter.

hom.sense: maA when following kul- or Uin-a or Oayona or OaI-, if having the signification of Al-aciI, is written separately. (El-Ḥareeree, in De Sacy's Anthol. Gram. Ar., p. 67 of the Ar. text.)

maA added to certain adverbial nouns is not merely redundant, but gives to them a conditional and general signification; as in OayonamaA Wherever; and HayovumaA Wherever, and whenever;, &c.: see Ḳur, ii. 143, 145, &c.: and see De Sacy's Gram., i. 537 and 538.
maA While; as in maA dumotu Hay-FA: and as much as; see Ḳur, lxiv. 16.
bimaA Because bimaA kaAnuwA yafosuquwna Because they did transgress; or for that they did transgress. (Ḳur.)
Uin-aka maA waxayorFA, for maEa xayorK. See xayorN.
maA is also added to a noun to denote the littleness of that which is signified by the noun; as in OarabN m-aA Some little want. (IAth in TA, art. Arb.)
maA in Oam-aA and Uim-aA (of which latter Uim-aA laA is an instance) I have mentioned in arts. Oam-aA and Uim-aA.
baAligFA maA balaga: see balaga.
maA Oanota [What art thou?] means what are thy qualities, or attributes? (Ḥar, p. 155.) maA rab-u AlEaAlamiyna, in the Ḳur, xxvi. 22, means OaI-N XaIoCK huwa. (Jel.) See also an ex. voce faI-.
maA laka signifies OaI-u XaIoCK vabata laka (IbrD) and may be rendered What aileth thee?
XaIoCN m-aA Some particular thing: something. (See Uiyhi.) Also, Any particular thing? (IbrD.) See an ex. cited voce SabaAHN.
fatFI m-aA fulaAnN An excellent youth is such a one. (IbrD.) See Kull, p. 336. See also Bḍ, middle p. 42.
maA is sometimes put for maA daAma, maA daAmuwA, and the like; i. e. As long as: see an ex. voce kaAZ-a, and Alt-uroku, and jal-a.

AlX-akolu UilaI AlT-uwli maA huwa The form inclines somewhat to length; agreeably with a rendering voce EuqorN: see De Sacy's Gr., sec. ed., i. 543 and 539: see also XaIoCN m-aA above: in the Ḳur xxxviii. 23, mA is redundant, (Bḍ,) denoting vagueness and wonder, (Ksh, Bḍ,) or a corroborative of fewness: (Jel:) it means somewhat whether great or little in degree or importance.

maA, the negative particle, followed by a pret., often requires the latter to be rendered in English by the preterperfect: ex. maA raOayotuhu muco yawomaAn I have not seen him for two days. See De Sacy's Anthol. Gram. Ar., p. 253.

entry.sense: maOoqN and muWoqN and maOoqK: see maOwFI.
maOaqapN A sobbing; i. e. an affection like what is termed fuwaAq, as though it were breath heaved from the chest, on an occasion of weeping, and of being choked with weeping. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
1. maOanahumo He sustained them; bore the burden of, or undertook, their maintenance; he maintained them. (Ṣ, Ḳ, arts. mOn and mwn.)
maOana Alqawoma and maO-anahumo↓ He maintained, or sustained, the people, or party. (M.)
2. maO-ana see 1.
maOonapN of the belly: see jaOobapN.
AlmaOonataAni of the hump of a camel: see qaHadapN.
muWonapN i. q. quwotN [Food,, &c.]; (M;) a dial. var. of maWuwnapN↓ (q. v.); as also muwnapN: pl. muWanN. (Mṣb.)
maYin-apN: see art. An, where will be found the explanations of this word given in the Ṣ and Ḳ in art. mOn.
maWwnapN A weight, or burden. (Mgh, Mṣb.) See mivoqaAlN.
Trouble, molestation, or embarrassment; as also muWonapN↓: pl. of the former maWuwnaAtN; and of the latter muWanN. (MA.)
The requisite means of subsistence. (KL.)
maWuwnapu AljimaAEi: see zaAfinapN: it seems to mean the pudendum muliebre considered as the means of jimaAE.
maAhiy-apN [The quiddity, or essence, or substance, of a thing;] that whereby a thing is what it is. (KT.) See also HaqiyqapN, and jawoharN, and caAtiy-apN, and maEonFI.
miYiynN: see siniynN, voce sanapN, in art. snh.
1. maOaI (like maACa) It (a cat) mewed. (TA, voce maACa, art. mwO.)
1. mataEa Aln-ahaAru The day became advanced, the sun being high, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) before the declining of the sun from the meridian. (Ḳ.).
2. mat-aEahu He (God) made him to live. (Bḍ in xi. 3.)
See mal-A.
mat-aEahaA He gave her a gift after divorce. (Ḳ.) And mat-ahaA bikacaA He gave her (a divorced wife) such a thing. (Mṣb.)

5. tamat-aEa bihi and AisotamotaEa↓ and AimotataEa↓ are syn., signifying AinotafaEa bihi zamaAnFA TawiylFA; (Ḥam, p. 343;) [He benefited, or profited by it; had the benefit, use, or enjoyment, of it; he enjoyed it; accord. to the above authority, for a long time; but this restriction is not always meant.] You say. AisotamotaEotu biQSoTibaAHi xamorK [I enjoyed the drinking a morning-draught of wine]: and biAlUiSogaMCi UilaI OagaAniI jaAriyapK [the listening to the songs of a girl]. (Moʼallaḳát, p. 169.)
tamat-aEa He became provided with mataAE, or utensils and furniture for the house, or tent. (TA, voce tabat-ata, q. v.)
tamat-aEa i. q. EaAXa. (Bḍ, Jel, xi. 68.)
tamat-aEa bihi generally signifies He enjoyed it: (MA:) so in many cases in the Ḳur, &c.
8. UimotataEa see 5.
10. AisotamotaEa bikacaA, and tamat-aEa↓, He benefited or profited by such a thing. (Mṣb.)
See 5.
musotamotuEN: see malobasN.
mutoEapN Enjoyment; a subst. in the sense of tamat-uEN; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) syn. naEomapN. (Jel, xlvi. 26.) See an ex., in a verse of Lebeed, voce faroTN.
mutoEapN A gift to a divorced wife. (Mṣb, Ḳ.) See mataAEN.
mtEp AlD-uHaI [i. e. mutoEap?] i. q. Oaw-aluhaA. (TA voce fiyqap, in art. fwq.)

mataAEN Anything useful or advantageous; as goods: such as the utensils and furniture of a house or tent, or household-goods: any utensils, or apparatus: chattels: a commodity, and commodities; (Mgh, &c.;) generally best rendered goods, chattels, household-goods or chattels, or utensils and furniture.
AlmataAEu [signifies ‡ Alfaroju;] a woman's pudendum: (TA:) [see mutawah-ijapN, in art. whj: and] the penis. (Mgh.)
mataAEN also applies to Food, the necessaries of life: see two exs. voce HafafN.
mataAEN for a divorced wife, A provision of necessaries, such as food and clothing and household-utensils or furniture: see EarofN, and Bḍ in ii. 242: i. q. tamotiyEN. (Bḍ in ii. 237.)
mataAEN i. q. maA yutamat-aEu bihi, and AlAisotimotaAEu; (Jel in iv. 79;) generally best rendered Enjoyment, in the Ḳur iv. 79 and ix. 38 and similar cases. See mutoEapN.
2. mat-anahu, inf. n. tamutiynN, He made it, or rendered it, strong, stout, form, or hard. (TA.)
mat-ana He seasoned a skin with rob, or inspissated juice (rub-). (Ḳ.)

matonu AlZ-ahori is The erector spinæ muscle, which consists of the sacro-lumbalis and longissimus dorsi and spinalis dorsi. The matonN is The back: (M, Mṣb:) or, as also matonapN↓, (M,) or matonaAni, (T,) two portions of firmly-bound flesh between which is the back-bone, [or that confine the back-bone,] rendered firm by being tied (maEoluwbataAni) with, or by, Eaqab [or sinews,] (T, M,) or the matonataAni are the two sides of the back. (M.)
matonaA AlZahori The two portions of flesh and sinew next the back-bone, on each side. (Ṣ.)

matonN [The broad side, or the middle of the broad side, of the blade, of a sword;] the part in the middle of which is the [ridge called] Eamuwd, (En-Naḍr, in L, voce EamuwdN,) or the part in which is the [ridge called] XuTobap, (Ḳ, voce safosaqapN,) and XaTiybap, and Eamuwd: (Ḳ, voce EamuwdN:) or the ridge [itself] (Eayor) rising in the middle of a sword. (T.)
matonN The hard and outer or apparent part of anything: pl. mutuwnN and mitaAnN. (M.)
matonN The middle of a bow, and of a spear. (Munjid of Kr.)
matonu Oucuni Alfarasi: see EayorN.
matonN The part between two poles of a bayot, or tent. (AZ in TA, art. rbE.)
matonN Elevated, and level, or plain, ground: (M:) or hard and elevated ground. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
matonu Alfarasi One of the four bright stars in Pegasus, that (a) at the extremity of the neck: see Alfarogu.
matonN i. q. HadiyvN and xabarN and OavarN, A tradition of Moḥammad, or of another, namely a companion of Moḥammad, &c. (IbrD.)
matonapN: see matonN.
matiynN Strong; stout; firm; hard. (Ṣ, Ḳ, Mṣb.) [Well seasoned. Possessing any quality in a strong degree.]
Oamotanu HalaAwapF, i. q. OaXad-u HalaAwapF, More sweet. (TA, voce HamotN.)
timotaAnN: see tamotiynN.
tamotiynN (a subst., properly speaking, like talobiybN, q. v.) and timotaAnN↓ The threads, or strings, of tents. (Ḳ.)
mataI signifies When? and when used to denote a condition: see Oan-aI and Oayona.
Hat-aI mataI Until when? how long? and also until the time when. See Freytag's Arab. Prov. i. 382.
1. mavala aor. _u {yamovulu}, inf. n. muvuwlN; (Ṣ, M, Ḳ, &c.;) and mavula; (M, Ḳ;) He stood erect; (Ṣ, M, Ḳ, &c.;) bayona yadayohi before him. (Ṣ, &c.)
mavala bihi, inf. n. muvolapN, He mutilated him; castrated him; namely, a sheep or goat. (TA in art. djn, from a trad.)
2. mav-ala: see a verse of Kutheiyir in art. rwd, conj. 4.
mav-alahu: see Xab-ahahu.
3. maAvalahu i. q. XaAbahahu. (TA.)
4. Oamovalahu He set it up: from mavala “he stood erect.”
He set up a butt or mark: see an ex. voce garaDN.
5. tamav-ala bikacaA [He affected to be like, or imitated, such a thing;] i. q. taXab-aha bihi. (TA, art. Xbh.)
tamav-ala Albayota and [more commonly] biAlbayoti He used, or applied, the verse as a proverb, or proverbially. (MA.)
See taXab-aha.

6. tamaAvala He became nearly in a sound, or healthy, state; or near to convalescence: (Ḳ:) or he became more like the sound, or healthy, than the unsound, or unhealthy, who is suffering from a chronic and pervading disease; (TA;) or so tmAvl liloburoCi. (M.) Said also of a wound: (T, Ṣ in art. dml:) and of a disease; like OaXokala. (TA, art. Xkl.)
tamaAvalaA i. q. taXaAbahaA. (M, Ḳ in art. swI.)
8. Aimotavala Oamorahu He followed his command, order, bidding, or injunction; did like as he commanded, ordered, &c.; (Mgh;) he obeyed his command, order, &c. (Mṣb.)
mivolN A like; a similar person or thing; match; fellow; an analogue. (Ḳ, &c.) See nid-N and voce badalN.
A likeness, resemblance, or semblance; see XabahN.
mivola, used as a denotative of state, means Like. Ex. mar-a mivola Albaroqi He passed like the lightning. See an ex. in the Ḳur li. 23; and another, from Sakhr-el-Gheí, voce faroDN.

mavalN i. q. SifapN [as meaning A description, condition, state, case,, &c.]; (Ṣ, Ḳ, &c.;) or waSofN [meaning the same]: (Mṣb:) or this is a mistake: (Mbr, AAF, TA:) or it may be a tropical signification: (MF, TA:) for in the language of the Arabs it means a description by way of comparison: (AAF, TA:) you say mvl zyd mvl flAn [The description of Zeyd, by way of comparison, or the condition, &c., is that of such a one]: it is from AlmivAalu and AlHacowu: (Mbr, TA:) it is metaphorically applied to a condition, state, or case, that is important, strange, or wonderful. (Ksh, Bḍ in ii. 16.) The phrase here given is more literally, and better, rendered, The similitude of Zeyd is the similitude, or is that, of such a one; for a similitude is a description by way of comparison.

You say also, jaEalahu mavalFA likacaA [He made it (an expression or the like) to be descriptive, by way of comparison, of such a thing]. (TA passim.) [And mavalN likacaA means An expression denoting, by way of similitude, such a thing.]
EalaI Almavali As indicative of resemblance to something.
See badalN.

mivaAlN Quality, made, manner, fashion, and form; (Mṣb;) a model according to which another thing is made or proportioned; a pattern, (miqodaArN) by which a thing is measured, proportioned, or cut out: (T:) an example of a class of words, of a rule, &c.
mino gayori saboqi mivAalK [Without there having been any precedent]. (Mṣb in art. qrH, &c.)
[A bed:] banAatu AlmivaAli The daughters of the bed; meaning women. (T in art. bnI.)
jawozu maAvilK: see jawozN.

tamaAviylu, in the following hemistich of Ibn-Aḥmar,
tamaAviylu qiroTaAsK EalaI habohabiy-apK
signifies kutubN yakotubuwnahaA. (L, in TA, voce habohabiI-N, as signifying a “light, or active,” camel.)
1. majara, app. an imitative sequent to fajara. See daEira.
1. majalato yaduhu His hand became blistered, or vesicated, by much work. (Mgh.)
majomajapN: see jamojama and HajoHaja.
1. majana He cared not for what he did (Ṣ. Mgh, Ḳ *) nor for what was said to him. (Mgh, Ḳ.*) The epithet is maAjinN. (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ.)

EuqobapN majuwnN [A stage of a journey, or a march or journey from one halting-place to another,] that is far, or distant, or long. (ISk in TA, voce baAsiTapN: but it is not quite clear in my copy of the TA whether it be majuwnN or hajuwnN.)
maj-aAnN The gift of a thing without price. (IF, Mṣb.)
faEalotuhu maj-aAnFA I did it without compensation. (Mṣb.) hecaA AlX-aIoCu lahu maj-aAnFA This thing is for him without an equivalent. (El-Farábee, Mṣb.)
maAjinN: see 1.
1. majonaquwA: see art. jnq.
maHotN and maHotapN: see OabotN.

1. maHaqa, aor. _a {yamoHaqu}, inf. n. maHoqN, He rendered a thing deficient, and deprived it of its blessing, or increase: or [he annihilated, annulled, or obliterated, it;] he did away with it wholly, so that no trace thereof remained. (Mṣb.)
OaEomadu mino kayolK muHi-qa↓, or muHiqa: see Eamada.
2. maH-aqa see 1.
layaAliI AlmuHaAqi: see daOodaMCN and Ald-aEojaMCu.
4. OamoHalati Aln-ujuwmu The stars set aurorally and brought no rain. (Ṣ, Ḳ * in art. xwI.)

5. tamaH-alotu maAlFA bigayori vamanK I laboured to acquire property without price: (Mṣb:) or, accord. to Az, tamaH-ala maAlFA means he laboured, and exercised art or management, in seeking [to acquire] property. (TA.) See also taEal-ava.
maHolN Drought, or suspension of rain, (Ṣ, Ḳ, Mṣb in art. jdb,) and dryness of the earth (Ṣ, Mṣb ubi suprà) depriving it of herbage; (Ṣ, TA;) and i. q. jadobN. (Ḳ.)
maHaAlapN: see art. Hwl; and see also fawohaMCu voce Oafowahu, and fawoqaMCu voce Oafowaqu, and qab-N.
labanN mumaH-alN Sour milk upon which much fresh is milked: see qaAriSN.
mutamaAHilN: see radaAHN.
miHonapN A trial, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) or trying affliction: (Ṣ:) pl. miHanN. (Mṣb.)
maHuwnapN (not muHuwnapN): see art. Hyn.
1. maHaAhu He effaced, erased, rased, obliterated, or cancelled, it; removed, or did away with, its impression or trace. (Ḳ.)
maHati Alr-iyHu Eanohu AlOasoqaAma waAld-unuwba The wind made to pass away, or dispelled, the clouds. (TA.)
maHaA AlS-uboHu All-ayola Daybreak dispelled the night. (TA.)
maHaAQll-ehu Eanohu AlOasoqaAma waAld-unuwba [God removed from him diseases and sins; as though He cancelled them]. (Mṣb in art. Efw.)
AlUiHosaAnu yamoHuw AlUisaMCapa Beneficence effaces, obliterates, or cancels, evil conduct. (TA)
mayodaAnN: see art. myd.
huwa Qbonu madiynatihaA, said of a skilful guide: see bajodapN.
1. madaha: see madaHa.
6. tamaAdaI fiI gay-ihi He persevered in his error. (Mṣb.)

madFI The utmost extent, term, limit, or reach, of a thing; syn. gaAyapN: (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ:) an extent, a distance; a space, an interval; syn. masaAfapN. [meaning a space that is, or that is to be, traversed] and hence used in the sense before explained because extending to a gAyp: (Z, in the Fáïk, quoted in the TA:) a goal. (The Lexicons passim.)
mudoyapN A butcher's knife. (Mgh.) See sik-iynN.
macuwqN Milk mixed with much water. (TA in art. fDx.)
mamocuwqu Aln-iqoIi [Having diluted marrow]; applied to a soft, or flabby, camel. (O, Ḳ in art. rk.)
EayoXN mamocuwqN † A turbid life. (TA in art. smr.)
Q. 4. Aimocaqar-ati AlUibilu The camels became dispersed. (TA in art. SEr.)
4. OamocaI Humorem tenuem e pene emisit vir propter lusum amatorium rel osculum. (Mṣb, &c.)

macoIN Humor tenuis qui propter lusum amatorium vel osculum e pene virili effluit: a discharge of a thin humour from the cakar, occasioned by amorous toying or by kissing: [app the prostatic fluid, a discharge from the prostate gland.] (Ṣ, Mṣb, &c.)
mac-aACN app., Is qui multum passus est seminis effluxum ex contactu feminæ aut osculo. See mazokuwtN. See also OamocaI.
maAciI-N Honey: (Ḳ:) or white honey: (Ṣ, M:) or fine, or thin, white honey. (AA, TA.)

mar-N A spade; [so in the present day;] syn. misoHaApN; (M, Ḳ;) with which one works in land of seed-produce: (M and Ḳ, voce baAlN:) or the handle thereof: (M, Ḳ;) and in like manner, of the miHoraAv [app. here meaning fire-shovel]: (M:) [see six-iynN] the thing with which one works in earth, or mud. (Ṣgh, TA.)
murayoraMCu An anæsthetic herb: see sakarapN.
marozN [an inf. n.] i. q. EayobN; as also lamozN. (Fr in TA, art. lmz.)
maraAsapN [A wooden rake or harrow:] i. q. malAasapN. (TA, art. SlE.)
miriToraATN [A sweet food:] i. q. faAluwcN; as also siriToraATN. (TA in art. zE.)
1. maruEa and OamoraEa↓ It (a valley) abounded with herbage. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
4. OamoraEa see 1.
muraEN, the bird so called: see an ex. voce bulaEN.
2. mar-aga He rolled, or turned over, a beast of carriage, in the dust. (Ḳ.)
mar-aga He smeared, seasoned, imbued, or soaked, a mess of variydi, with grease, or gravy, or dripping; i. q. raw-aga, and das-ama, and sagobala. (TA in art. rwg.)
3. maAragahu [He rolled with him upon the ground, or in the dust]; said of a man after his wrestling with another. (TA in art. rsg.) See 3, in that art.
8. Aimotaraqa He drew a sword from its scabbard. (TA, voce Aihotalaba; and voce AiEotaq-a.)
maroqu AlUihaAbi The burying of the skin, or hide, in the earth, so that its hair may be removed, and it may become ready for tanning. (Ḳ,* TA in art. Afq.) See also falaqa.
maraqN in grapes: see suk-arN.
maraqN Broth; gravy-soup; and any decoction.
sahomN maAriqN An arrow of which the whole has passed through the animal at which it is shot. (A, art. mrd.) See SaAridN, and mugotalimu.
mur-iyqN: see dur-iIoCN.
mur-ayoq in the Ḳ is a mistake for mur-iyq. (TA.) See also Eul-iy-apN, in art. Elw, in which mur-iyqapN is mentioned as the n. un.

sense.hi: A kind of small lantern in the roof of a chamber, for the admission of air, generally octagonal, the sides of wooden lattice-work, and the top a cupola; a sky-light; any kind of window or aperture in a roof.

entry.sense: 1. marana It was, or became smooth, (Ṣ, M, Ḳ,) with a degree of hardness. (M, Ḳ.) Said of a camel's foot: see OasoHaqa.
marana EalaI XaIoCK He became accustomed, habituated, or inured, to a thing. (Ḳ.)
2. mar-anahu He made it soft, or smooth, lay-in. (Mṣb.)
maArinN The [soft, or cartilagenous] part of the nose, beneath, or exclusive of, the bone. (Zj, in his “Khalk el-Insán:” and the like is said in the Ṣ and Mṣb, and partially in the Ḳ.)
1. Alr-iyHu tamoriI Als-aHaAba and tamotariyhi↓ The wind draws forth the clouds. (M, TA.) See an ex. in a verse cited voce EazolaMCu.

3. maAraAhu, inf. n. mumaAraApN and miraMCN, i. q. jaAdalahu; (Ṣ, Ḳ;*) He disputed with him, or did so obstinately,, &c.: (TA:) it is only in opposing [what has been said; not in commencing a disputation]. (Mṣb.)
6. Alt-amaAriI The disputing, or contending, together. (TA.) You say, humaA yatamaArayaAni biAlX-iEori [They two dispute, or contend, together, with verses or poetry]. (TA in art. bdh.)
8. AimotraI He doubted, bh of it. (Ḳur, xliii. 61.)
See 1.
10. Aisotamorati AlUibilu AlmHamoDa for AisotamoraOatohu: see 1 in art. Edn.
marowN A certain plant: see xaAfuwrN, and HabaqN, and faAxuwrN.
maziyrN Strong-hearted. (Ṣ.) So I have rendered the fem. (with p {maziyrapN}) in explaining balohaMCu: it seems there to mean bold.
2. maz-aqa † He scattered, or dispersed. (Ḳur, xxxiv, 18; and Expos. of the Jeláleyn.)

[maz-aqa, used tropically, may sometimes be rendered † He mangled, rent much, or dissundered; but more generally, † he, or it, shattered, disorganized, or dissipated; or † he, or it, marred, or impaired; being opposed to OaSolaHa, or to raqaEa or raq-aEa, in the sense of OaSolaHa, as in an ex. cited voce raqaEa; sometimes several of these renderings will be found to be appropriate in a single instance. You say, maz-aqa EiroDahu † He mangled, rent, or shattered, or marred, his honour, or reputation. And maz-aqa Eaqolahu, and raOoyahu, and Oamorahu, † It shattered, or disorganized or dissipated, or it marred or impaired, his intellect, and his judgment, and his state of affairs or circumstances.]
maz-aqahu He rent it, or tore it, much; or in several, or many, places. mangled, or dissundered, it; and cut it much;, &c. (TA.)

5. tamaz-aqa Ealayohi Eaqoluhu † [His intellect became shattered, or dissipated, or impaired]. (TA in art. raqaEa.) And tamaz-aqa Ealayohi raOoyuhu waOamoruhu † [His judgment, and his state of affairs or circumstances, became shattered, disorganized, dissipated, marred, or impaired.] (A and TA in art. rqE.) See maz-aqa, of which tamaz-aqa is quasi-pass.
tamaz-aquwA † They became scattered, or dispersed. (TA.)
tamaz-aqa EiroDuhu † His honour, or reputation, became mangled, rent, or shattered, or marred.
mazoqN The rending, tearing, or slitting, a garment and the like. (JK.)
mizoqapN A piece torn off of a garment (Ṣ, Ḳ *), &c. (Ḳ.)
mizaAqN [A she-camel] whose skin almost becomes rent in pieces by reason of her swiftness. (O in art. Ensq.)
muzonN Clouds (Ḳ, and Ḥam, p. 564) of any kind: (Ḥam, ibid:) or white clouds: (Ṣ, Ḳ, and Ḥam, p. 53:) or clouds containing water. (Ḳ.)
Uibonu maAzinK The ant. (TA in art. bnI.)
2. tamoziyapN The praising, or eulogizing [another]. (Ḳ, TA.) You say, maz-ayotuhu Ealayohi, syn. faD-alotuhu. (IAạr, TA.)
5. tamaz-ayota EalayonaA Thou thoughtest, or hast thought, thyself superior to us in excellence: and so tafaD-alota. (TA.)
6. tamaAzawoA i. q. tafaADaluwA. (TA.)
maziy-apN An excellent quality; an excellence. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
1. yumosiku Alr-amaqa: see art. rmq.
2. mas-aka biAln-aAri: see vq-b.
4. Oamosaka He retained; he withheld. (Mṣb.)
He maintained: he was tenacious, or niggardly.
He, or it, held fast a thing: and arrested it.
Oamosakahu He held, retained, detained, restrained, stayed, confined, imprisoned, or withheld, him. (Ḳ.)
Oamosaka Eani AlOamori He held, refrained, or abstained, from the thing. (Mṣb.)

Oamosakahu He grasped it, clutched it, laid hold upon it; or seized it, (qabaDa Ealayohi) biyadihi with his hand: (Mṣb:) or he took it; or took it with his hand, (Oaxacahu,) namely, a rope, &c.: (Mgh:) or he held, or clung, to it: (TA:) [as also tamaska↓ bihi]. Also, Oamosaka bihi signifies [the same; or] he laid hold upon, or seized, somewhat of his body, or what might detain him, as an arm or a hand, or a garment, and the like: but Oamosaqahu may signify he withheld him, or restrained him, from acting according to his own free will. (Mugh, art. bi.)
Oamosaka baTonahu [It bound, or confined, his belly (or bowels)]: said of medicine. (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ; all in art. Eql.)
AlUimosaAk, in relation to taHojiyl: see an unusual application of it in art. Tlq, conj. 4.
5: see 4 and 8.
tamas-aka biHabolihi He held fast by his covenant: see OaEoSama.
6. tamaAsaka He withheld, or restrained, himself: (PṢ:) he was able, or powerful; as also tamaAlaka, q. v. (KL.)
maA tamaAsaka Oano faEala kacaA He could not restrain himself from doing so; syn. maA tamaAlka. (Ṣ.)
Uin-ahu lacuw tamaAsukK † Verily he possesses intelligence. (TA.) And maAbihi tamaAsukN ‡ There is no good in him. (TA.) See musokapN.
10. Aisotamosaka AlbaTonu [The belly (or bowels) became bound, or confined]. (TA in art. Eql.)
Aisotamosaka bihi [sometimes] He sought to lay hold upon it. (Bḍ, in ii. 257.)
Aisotamosaka: see an ex. voce SiroEapN.
misokN [Musk: it is obtained from the muskdeer, moschus moschiferus; being found in the male animal, in a vesicle near the navel and prepuce.] It is masc. and fem. (IAmb, TA voce cakiI-N.)
masakN Tortoise-shell; syn. cabolN: (Ḳ:) bracelets made of tortoise-shell (cabolN), or of EAj [ivory]: (Ṣ, Mṣb:) bracelets and anklets made of horn and of EAj: n. un. with musokapN. (Ḳ.)

musokapN Intelligence: (Mṣb:) or full intelligence, (Ḳ, TA,) and judgment; judgment and intel-ligence to which one has recourse; as also musokN, not masiykN↓, as in the Ḳ; (TA;) i. q. tamaAsukN. (Mgh.) You say, layosa lahu musokapN He has no intel-ligence. (Mṣb.)
layosa bihi musokapN He has no strength. (Mṣb.)
musokaAnN: see art. skn.
misaAkN or masaAkN A kind of needles: see midaAdN.
masiykN: see musokapN.
[mas-aAkAtN in the CK, art. rwD, written mus-AkAt,] Places, in land, or in the ground, to which the rain-water flows, and which retain it. (TA.) See DaAbiTapN.
mumosakN, said of a horse, white on both fore and kind leg on the same side: see muHaj-alN.
mutamaAsikN Compact in the limbs, (TA in art. bdn,) or flesh. (TA in this art.)
masalN: see masiylN, in art. syl.
2. mas-aAhu bikacaA He came to him in the evening with such a thing. (TA, voce Sab-aHa.)
4. OamosaI He entered upon the masaMC. (Mṣb.)
OamosaI as syn. with SaAra: see an ex. voce naXaTa, in a verse of Himyán, and another voce EasaI.
Oanayotuhu limisoIi xaAmisapK: see SuboHN.
masaMCN Afternoon, counted from noon to sunset: (Az, IḲooṭ, Mgh, Mṣb, TA:) or, accord. to some, to midnight: (TA:) contr. of SabaAH: (Ṣ, Ḳ, Mṣb, &c.:) and evening, after sunset. (Mgh.)
Oatayotuhu caA masaMCK [I came to him in the evening]. (IAạr, TA, art. SbH.) See SabaAHN.
Oatayotupu SabaAHFA masaMCF: see SabaAHN.
Oamosiy-apN: see OuSobuwHap.

mamosFI a name for the masaMC; and the time thereof; and the place thereof; like as maSobaHN is a name for the SabaAH; and the time thereof; and the place thereof. (Marg. note in a copy of the Ṣ, in art. SbH.)
musotamosakN A place, or thing, to lay hold of: see maEaD-N.
R. Q. 2. tamaXomaXati AlUibilu The camels became dispersed. (TA in art. SEr.)
1. tamoXiyqN He elongated the handwriting: or was quick in it. (M.)
2. tamoXiyqN The act of lacerating much: see an ex. voce daHiyqN.
kitaAbu maXoqK Writing with spaces, or gaps, and with elongated letters; (JK;) [or quick, or hasty, writing; (see maXaqa;)] contr. of kitaAbu Alt-aHaAsiyni. (Ḳ in art. Hsn.)

muXaAqapN [the hards, or hurds, of flax or hemp and any similar coarse fibres: (see salabN:) or tow; i. e.] what falls from the combing of hair and flax and the like: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or what is long: or not cleared: (Ḳ:) or what remains, of flax, after combing, that is, after it has been drawn through the mimoXaqap↓, [or heckle,] which is a thing like a comb, whereby the best becomes cleared, the broken particles and integuments, which constitute the muXaAqap, remaining. (Mgh.)
muX-aqN A certain sea-fish. (Ḳ, voce mud-ajN: in the CK, muXaq-N.)
mimoXaqapN: see muXaAqahN.
mamoXuwqN A man light of flesh: (Ḳ:) a horse lean, lank, light of flesh, slender, or lank in the belly. (Ṣ.)
mamoXuwqapN A damsel tall and slender: (Ḳ:) slender: or perfect in make, and goodly, or beautiful: (Mṣb:) or goodly, or beautiful, in stature. (Ṣ.)
2. tamoXiylN: see tafoXiylN.
1. maXana AlOadiyma He pared, or removed the superficial part of, the hide. (TA in art. Adm.)
6. tamaAXana He wiped his hands together: see ZaribaAnN.
muwXaAnN: see juracN.
timoXaMCN: see tiboyaAnN, voce bay-ana.

1. maXaI He walked, went, or went along; (MA, KL;) [in its primary sense] He went any pace upon his feet, afoot, or on foot; he footed; whether quickly or slowly: (Mgh, Mṣb:) he removed from place to place at pleasure: (Er-Rághib:) walked; went along, marched; travelled; trod; paced; stepped. See 5.
maXaI also signifies He went on, or continued, in his course of action,, &c. (Mughnee voce Oano, in explanation of this verb as used in Ḳur xxxviii. 5.)
[maXaI † It (money) passed; was, or became, current.]
[† It (a calumny) was, or became, current. See miYobarN.]
maXaI banoTuhu [His belly became moved, or in motion; it discharged itself.] (Ṣ, Ḳ, art. Tlq;, &c.)
2. maX-aIa see 4.
3. maAXaAhu He walked, or went on foot, with him: he kept pace with him. See an ex. voce AlOaHoS-aAni.
4. OamoXaIa Ald-awaMCu baTonahu (A, Ḳ, art. Hdr,) [The medicine moved, or purged, his bowels; made his belly to discharge itself:] and maX-aI↓ AlbaTona. (TA, art. Tws, &c.)

5. tamaX-aI i. q. maXaI: (TA:) [or, properly, and accord. to general usage, he walked with slow steps: so I have rendered it voce dalafa, &c.:] he walked heavily, with an effort. (TḲ voce tazaH-afa.) [One says in the present day, xarajotu OatamaXaI I went forth taking a walk; and tamaX-aI He walked; walked about.]
[Hence the saying,] tamaX-ato fiyhi Humay-aA AlkaOosi [The intoxicating influence of the cup of wine pervaded him, or] crept in him. (TA.) See also tafaX-aI.
6. tamaAXawoA They walked, or went on foot, one towards, or to, another. (TA.)
10. AisotamoXaI biAld-awaMCi [He used the medicine as a laxative or purgative. (IbrD.)] (Az in L, art. Eqr.)
AisotamoXaI bihi, referring to a plant, (Ḳ in art. SE,) He drank its water (i. e. infusion or the like) for moving the bowels. (TA ibid.)
maX-aMCN [That goes with energy; a good or strong goer;] strong to walk, or go, or go on foot. (TA voce rijiylN.)
dawaMCu AlmaXiI-i Medicine that moves, or purges, the bowels. (TA in art. Tws.)
maAXiyapN A she-camel having numerous offspring. (Ṣ, Mgh.)
Hence, and mawaAXK, as ominous of good, Camels, and cows, and sheep or goats that are for breeding and gain. (Mgh.)
mamoXaI A passage, or way, by a place; (TA;) [a walking-place: the gangway of a ship?]
4. OamoSaEato biwaladihaA She (a woman) brought forth, or cast forth, her child with a single moan, or hard breathing [or with a single throe;] like zakabato bihi. (IAạr, L, art. Hfd.)
maSolN [A kind of AqT]: see kavNCN and EabiyvN.
maDofN: see siyaraMCu.
1. maDaI and tamaD-aI↓ i. q. taqad-ama [He advanced, proceeded,, &c.]. (M.)
maDaI He, or it, passed; passed away; went; or went away. (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
[He went on.]
maDaI lahu, said of time: see tasohiymN.
[maDaI fiI sayorihi He advanced, or pressed onward, with a penetrative energy or force, or a sharpness and effectiveness, in his pace.]
maDaIa AlOamoru, and Alqawolu, † The command, or order, and the saying, was effectual; had effect; was, or became, executed, or performed; syn. nafaca. (Mṣb, art nfc.)

maDaI fiI AlOamori † He acted [or went on, and did so] with penetrative energy, or with sharpness, vigour, and effectiveness, in the affair; syn. nafaca. (Ṣ, M, Ḳ.) See maADK fiI AlOumuwri, below; and jasara.
maDaI EalaI AlOamori He executed, performed, or accomplished, the affair; as also OamoDaAhu↓: (Ṣ:) and he kept, or applied himself, constantly, or perseveringly, to it. (Mṣb.)
maDayotu ElI bayoEiI and OamoDayotuhu↓ I effected, or executed, my sale. (Ḳ.)
maDaI It (a sword) cut; (M, Ḳ;) penetrated; was sharp.
4. OamoDaAhu [† He made it (i. e., a contract, sale, oath, &c.) to take effect; executed it; performed it.]
OamoDaI AlOamora: see maDaI EalaI AlOamori.
OamoDaI Alyamiyna He made the oath to be unconditional, without exception, absolutely or decisively or irreversibly binding. (TḲ voce jazama.) See jazama.
OamoDaI Eahodahu † He made his covenant, or contract, or the like, to have, or take, effect; executed or performed it. (L, art. nfc.)
OamoDaI raOoyFA He formed, or gave, a decided opinion.
OamoDaI He signed a writing with his name, and so rendered it effective.
See 1.
5. tamaD-aIa see 1.
maADK fiI AlOumuwri [† Penetrating, sharp, energetic, or acting with penetrative energy, or vigorous, and effective, in the performing of affairs: like XaHoXaHN, q. v.]

[maADK is coupled with the epithets maAhirN and jaAd-N, &c., and implies penetration and skill, or proficiency in anything;] excelling, or surpassing, in doing, or performing, a thing: (KL from the “Destoor”:) [it is also coupled with jariIoCN and mutaqad-imN, in the T, art. jhr. See also naAficN, its syn.]
OamorN maADK † A command, or an order, that is effectual; that has effect; that is executed, or performed; syn. naAficN. (L, art. nfc.)
farasN maADK † A sharp, spirited, vigorous horse [&c.]; contr. of baliydN; (Lth, TA, voce nadobN;) exerting, or having, a penetrative energy,, &c.: see maDI.
kaAna celika fiI Alz-amani AlmaADiI That was in the time that is past; contr. of Almusotaqobal. (TA.)
timoDaMCN One who performs affairs with energy and perseverance: an intensive epithet: see SamayaAnN.
5. tamaT-aqa He tasted repeatedly, or smacked his lips: see two explanations of this verb voce lamaZa.

1. maTalahu bidayonihi, inf. n. maTolN, and maATalahu↓, inf. n. maTaAlN, He delayed, or deferred, with him, or put him off, in the matter of his debt, by promising time after time to pay him. (Mṣb.) See daAfaEotuhu and saw-afahu.
3. maAoTala see 1.
maTuwlN Much given to delaying, or deferring, with a creditor, or putting him off, in the matter of a debt, by promising time after time to pay him. (Mṣb.)
mamoTuwlN Iron, or a sword, (Az, TA,) beaten into a long shape: (Az, Ḳ:) or anything extended, elongated, or lengthened. (Ṣ.)
1. maTaA signifies He drew, or pulled, a thing; as, for instance, a well-rope: [for] mad-N and maT-N and maTowN are all one. (Az and TA in art. mT.) See an ex. from Zuheyr, voce vinaAyapN.
5. tamaT-aI He stretched, in a neuter sense: as also tamaT-aTa and tamad-ada.
muTaOLCu [for muTawaMCu?] A stretching, through weariness, &c.? (TA, art. vOb.)

maTiy-apN A camel: (Mṣb:) a camel, or beast, that one rides; a beast that goes with energy and speed: (Ḳ:) or a she-camel, or he-camel, that is used for riding; (TA;) [and so a horse,, &c.;] a saddle-camel, or camel that one rides. (KL.)
See two exs. of a metaphorical meaning voce zaEama.
muTawaMCu The stretching oneself by reason of fever. (As in TA, voce buraHaACu.)
See vuwabaMCu.

maEa [generally thus in all cases] is a word, or noun, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) or particle, (Ḳ,) denoting concomitance, (Ṣ, Ḳ,), &c. (Ḳ.) It is said to denote the commencement of concomitance, though this is not invariably the case. (MF and TA, voce fiI.)
jiYotu maEa AlEaSori means Einoda AlEaSori. (Mughnee.)
8. AimotaEasa: see Oalowava.
1. maEiSa: see mugiSa.
1. maEuqa: see Eamuqa.
4. maA OamoEaqahaA: see Emq.
maEiyqN: see EamiyqN.
mutamaE-aku Alfarasi (T, art. rdI) or AlHimaAri (Ṣ, M, art. rdI) The horses' or asses' place of rolling upon the ground. See rdI.
maEolN [not maEilN] An agile, acute, clever, man: see XaEolN.
4. OamoEana He (a horse) went far, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) in his run. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)
Hence, OamoEana fiI AlT-alabi He went very far in search: (Mṣb:) or he went far, or to a great or an extraordinary length, therein. (Mgh.)
AmEn fiI AlX-aIoCi, (Ḥam p. 817,) or fiI AlOamori, (MA, Ḳ, Ḥar p. 176,) He went far, (Ḳ, Ḥam, Ḥar,) or deep, or beyond bounds, (MA,) in, or into, the thing, or affair. (Ḥam, &c.)
OamoEana liI biHaq-iI: see OacaEona.
AlmaEonu The drawing of water.
miEFI A narrow, depressed place (See TaOoTaACN.)
banaAtN miEFI The baEor. (T in art. bnI.)
OamoEaMCu: see a tropical signification (water-holes) of this pl. voce Hawiy-apu.
maAqiTN A player with the ball. (O in art. SwE.) See SaAEN, last sentence.
3. maAqalahu, inf. n. mumaAqalapN He vied with him in diving: see gaAmasahu.
6. tamaAqalaA: see tagaATasaA.
muqolN The Theban palm; palma Thebaïca of Pococke; the cucifera of Theophrastes.
Also The xuwS, or leaves, of the tree thus called: see nZm
See also SamogN.
maqolahN, for juroEapu maqolapK: see 3 in art. Sfn.
muqolapN The ball, or globe, or bulb (lit. fat, XaHomap), of the eye, i. e., the eyeball, which comprises the white and the black. (Khalk el-Insán of Zj; and Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
1. makara bihi i. q. xadaEahu, (Mṣb, &c.,) see kaAdahu.
makorN [Artifice; machination; stratagem; fraud; fraudulence; guile].

2. mak-anahu He gave him a place: (Jel, vi. 6:) he assigned him a place, and settled, or established, him. (Bḍ, ibid, where see more.) You say also, mak-ana lahu fiI manozilK [He assigned, or gave, him a place in an abode]. (Ṣ in art. bwO.)
mak-anahu mino XaIoCK, and Oamokanahu↓, He made him to have mastery, or dominion, or ascendancy, or authority, and power, over a thing; (Mṣb;) put it in his power.

mak-anahu mina AlX-aIoCi, and Oamokana↓ minohu, He empowered him, enabled him, or rendered him able, to do the thing: he enabled him to have the thing within his power. Ex. Oamokana↓ yadayohi mino rukobatayohi He enabled his hands to take and grasp his knees. from a trad. (Mgh.)
4. Oamokanahu mino XaIoCi He made him to have a thing within his power, or reach: enabled him to do, reach, get, or obtain, a thing. See 2.

sense.hi: It was within his power, or reach; was possible, or practicable, to him.

entry.sense: Oamokanahu It became easy to him. (Mṣb.) It (an object of the chase) offered him an opportunity to shoot it or capture it; or became within his power, or reach.
OamokiniI, said to a woman, [meaning Empower thou; i. e. grant thou access;] occurs in a poem. (Ṣ, art. ErD.)

5. tamak-ana i. q. Aisotaqar-a: (Mṣb, art. qr:) it is very often used in this sense, as meaning He, or it, settled; became fixed, or established; it became fixed, or steady, in its place; when said of a man, particularly implying in authority and power: see qar-a.

tamak-ana mino XaIoCK, and Aisotamokana↓, He became possessed of mastery, or dominion, or ascendancy, or authority, and power, over a thing; he was able to avail himself of it: [he was, or became, within reach of him, or it.] (Mṣb.)
10. Aisotamokana: see 5.
He, or it, was, or became, firm. It seems sometimes to mean It (a plant) took firm root.
mukonapN, (Mṣb, TA,) with damm, (TA,) Power; (Mṣb,* TA;) ability; (TA;) strength. (Mṣb.)
makinapN i. q. tamak-unu. (Sh, TA.)
Aln-aAsu EalaI makinaAtihimo means ElI maqaAr-ihimo. (IAạr, TA.)
mak-aAnu: see maS-aAnN in art. mS.
makonaAnN: see ray-iHapN.
makaAnapN Greatness, and high rank or standing. in the estimation of the Sultán: (Mṣb:) an honourable place in the estimation of a king. (Ḳ.)
jalasa mutamak-inFA He sat in a firm, or settled, posture; as when one sits cross-legged.
muk-aMCN The bird so called, because of its colour: see Oaxoraju.
1. mal-ahu He put it (namely bread, or flesh-meat,) into hot ashes, [to bake, or roast]. (Ḳ, &c.)
mal-a Alv-awoba He sewed, or tacked, the garment, or piece of cloth, [slightly,] previously to the [stronger] sewing termed Alkaf-. (Ṣ.) See also Xal-a.
malilotuhu, & malilotu Eanohu, I was avers from it; (T;) loathed it; was disgusted by it, with it, or at it; (T, Ṣ, Ḳ;) [was weary of it;] turned away from it with disgust. (T.) See saYima.
mal-a malAaluka [May thy disgust pass away, or cease]: see OaDal-a Qll-ehu DalaAlaka.
4. Oamolalotu & Oamolayotu: see 4 in art. HZ.
Oamal-a: see an ex. voce Oadal-a.
8. Aimotal-a mil-atahu He follows his way of religion: see 8 in art. XrE.
mal-apN The hollow that is made for baking bread: or the hot dust and ashes [in which the bread is baked]. (Mṣb.)
Hot ashes: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) ashes, and earth, in which fire is kindled. (TA, art. xbz.)
xubozu mal-apK Bread baked in hot ashes. (Ṣ.) [It is generally made in the form of thick round cakes.]
mil-apN A religion; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) a way of belief and practice in respect of religion. (T, &c.)
See 8.
maluwlN Conceiving [frequent] disgust. (Mṣb.) See caw-aAqN.
malAalN: see 1.
mamoluwlN Flesh-meat covered over in live coals. (TA, art. ErD.)
See maliylN.
mulomuwlN An iron style with which one writes on tablets. (Ḳ.)

The style, or bodkin, with which collyrium is applied to the eyes. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) In the CK, incorrectly, malomuwlN: the former is found in MṢ. copies of the Ḳ, as well as in the Ṣ, and is right accord. to the TḲ.
maliyEN: see gumoluwlN.
1. malaqahu He flayed him with a whip: like salaqahu. (TA in art. slq.)

5. tamal-aqahu, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) and tamal-aqa lahu, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) inf. n. tamal-uqN and timil-aAqN, [like tiHim-aAlN and tikil-aAmN, not tamolaAqN as in the CK,] He behaved in a loving, or an affectionate, and a blandishing, or coaxing, manner to him. (Ṣ, Mṣb,* Ḳ.) See a verse cited in art. rDw, conj. 5.
malaqiy-apN [A swiftly-running mare]. See Eab-ara bihi. mal-aAqN Vehement in journeying, or in his pace; i. q. mal-aAxN. (TA, voce mal-aAxN.)
mimolaqapN A harrow: see mal-asa.

hom.sense: 1. malakahu He possessed it, or owned it, [and particularly] with ability to have it to himself exclusively: (M, Ḳ:) [and he exercised, or had, authority over it; for] mulokN signifies the exercise of authority to command and to forbid in respect of the generality of a people [&c.]: (Er-Rághib, TA:) or the having possession and command or authority: and the having power to exercise command or authority. (TA.) milokN, as inf. n. of malakahu meaning He possessed it, is more common than malokN and mulokN.
[malaka Oamorahu He had the ruling, or ordering, of his affair, or case] And malaka EalaI Aln-aAsi Oamorahumo He had the dominion, or sovereignty, or ruling power, over the people. (Mṣb.)
See 4.

entry.sense: 2. mal-akahu He made him to possess a thing; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) as also Oamolakahu↓. (Ḳ.)
He made him king; or made him to have dominion, kingship, or rule. (Mṣb, Ḳ.)
yumal-aka Alr-ajulu Oamorahu [The man shall be made to have the ruling, or ordering, of his affair, or affairs, or case]. (Sh, T in art. dyn.)
3. maAlka Oum-ahu: see Xadana.

hom.sense: 4. malaka↓ AlEajiyna and Oamolakahu He kneaded well the dough. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
See 2.

entry.sense: 5. tamal-aka He took possession of a thing [absolutely or] by force. (Mṣb.)
6. maA tamaAlaka Oano faEala He could not restrain himself from doing; (Mgh, Mṣb;) syn. maA tamaAsaka [q. v.] (Ṣ.)
milokN: its pl. OamolAakN, in common conventional language means [or rather includes] Houses and lands. (TA.) See its pl. pl. OamolAakaAtN.

sense.hi: Dominion; sovereignty; kingship; rule; mastership; ownership; possession; right of possession; authority; sway.

entry.sense: muloku Qll-ehi God's world of spirits; or invisible world. (TA, art. Xhd.)
[mulokN (when distinguished from mlkwt) The dominion that is apparent; as that of the earth.]
malakN An angel: see maOolakN.
malakN Water. (Ṣ.)
maliku AlOamolAaki The king of kings. See OaxonaEu.

malAaku AlOamori and milAakuhu↓ That whereby the thing, &c. subsists: (Ṣ, KL:) its qiwaAm [q. v.] by whom, or by which, it is ruled, or ordered: (Ḳ:) its foundation; syn. OaSoluhu: (KL:) its support; that upon which it rests: (T, TA:) it may be rendered the cause, or means, of the subsistence of the thing;, &c.
milaAkN see malAakN.
maAlikN: see rab-N.
maAliku AlOamori The possessor of command, or rule.
AlmaAliku Alkabiyru The Great Master, or Owner; i. e., God; in contradistinction to AlmaAliku AlS-agiyru the little master, or owner; i. e., the human owner of a slave, &c.

maAlikN AlHaziynu: (so in one copy of the Ṣ: in another, and the MA, and Ḳzw, maAliku AlHaziyni:) [The heron: or a species thereof] in Pers. bwtymAr; (MA;) a certain bird, long in the neck and legs, called in Pers. bwtymAr. (Ḳzw:) see sabayoTarN
Oabuw maAlikK Hunger. (MF, art. jbr.) See also OabN.
OamolaAkaAtN pl. of OamolAakN pl. of milokN Goods, or chattels, of a bride: see OagonaMCN in art. gnI.
malakapN [A faculty.] A quality firmly rooted in the mind. (KT.)
malakuwtu Qll-ehi God's world of corporeal beings. (TA, art. Xhd.) Generally The kingdom of God.

miliyk is also syn. with mamoluwkN; this is meant in the TA where it is said that mulakaMCu in the saying labaA muluwkN walayosa labaA mulakaMCu [We have kings of bees, but we have not slaves] is pl. of Almaliyku from Almamoluwku: it is also said in art. rgw in the TA, (see 4 in that art.) that maliykapN is syn. with mamoluwkapN.
Oamolaku: see XaroTN, and also OamolaOu, and OarabN.
maA Oamoliku Xad-FA walAa UiroxaMCF: see Xad-a.
mamolakapN A kingdom, or realm. (Ṣ.)
mamoluwkN A slave; a bondman; syn. EabodN, (Ṣ,) or raqiyqN. (TA.) In the present day, specially, A white male slave. (TA.) See marobuwbN.
1. mul-iIa OabAahu: see labisa OabaAhu in art. lbs.
mul-iytu fulAabFA I was made to live long with such a one. (Ḥam, p. 412.)
mal-aAka Qll-ehu Habiybaka May God make thee to have enjoyment of thy friend (mat-aEaka bihi) and to live long with him. (Ṣ.) See labisa.
4. Oamolayotu and Oamolalotu: see 4 in art. HZ.
5. tamal-aI AlEayoXa He lived long. (T.)
tamal-ayotu Eumorahu: see a verse of Ibn-Aḥmar cited voce OabolaI in art. blw.
maliy-FA A while: (Mṣb:) or a long time. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)

1. man-a Ealayohi, (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ,) aor. _u {yamonunu}, (Mṣb,) inf. n. man-N (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ) and min-iynaI; (Ḳ;) and Amtn-↓; (Mṣb;) He conferred, or bestowed, upon him, a favour, or benefit. (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ.) You say, man-a Ealayohi XayoOF, and biXaIoCK, which latter is more common, and Amtn-↓ Elyh bihi He conferred, or bestowed, a thing upon him as a favour. (Mṣb.)

man-a Ealayohi, (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ,) inf. n. man-N (T, Mṣb) or min-apN; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) and Amtn↓ (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ) and tmn-n↓; (M;) He reproached him for a favour, or benefit, which he (the former) had conferred, or bestowed; (M;) he recounted his gifts or actions to him. (Mṣb.) Ex., Aimotan-a↓ EalayohaA bimaA maharahaA [He reproached her for the dowry he had given her]. (Ḳ, art. mhr.) See Bḍ, ii. 264. See also an ex. in a verse cited voce sarifa.
5. taman-a see 1.
8. Uimotana see 1.

mano [used for maA in the sense of What? as in the following of El-Khansà,
OalaA mano liEayoniI laA tajif-u dumuwEuhaA
O! what aileth mine eye, that its tears dry not? quoted in the TA, art. fvO.]
mano: respecting its dual manaAno and manayono, and its pl. manuwno and maniyno, see I’Aḳ, p. 319.
mano liI bikacaA: see bi (near the end of the paragraph).

zayodN OaEoqalu mino Oano yakocib means mina Alc-aI yakocibu (Kull, p. 78) [i. e. Zeyd is more reasonable than he who lies: but, though this is the virtual meaning, the proper explanation, accord. to modern usage, is, that Oano is here for Oan-a with the adjunct pronoun hu; for in a phrase of this kind, an adjunct pronoun is sometimes expressed; so that the aor. must be marfooa; and the literal meaning is, Zeyd is more reasonable than that he will lie; which is equivalent to saying, Zeyd is too reasonable to lie. It may be doubted, however, whether a phrase of this kind be of classical authority. The only other instance that I have found is huwa OaHoSanu mino Oano yoraAm waOaEaz-u min Oano yuDaAm, in the TA, voce Oalo. Accord. to modern usage, one may say, Oanota OaEoqalu mino Oan-aka tafoEalu kacaA, which virtually means Thou art too reasonable to do such a thing; and here we cannot substitute Ql-acin for Oan-. See Oano for Oan-a.]
OaxozaI Qll-ehu AlkaAciba min-iI waminoka: see OaI-N
laqiytu minohu OasadFA: see OasodN: and laqiytu
minohu baHorFA; and raOayotu minohu baHorFA: see bHr
mino in the sense of Einoda: see jad-N
jaraI minohu majoraI kacaA: see 1 in art. jrI
mino and Eano, differences between: see Eano
mino often means Some.
Often redundant: see 1 in art. EyD.
Of, or among: see two exs. voce fiI, latter part.

HusayonN min-iI waOanaA minohu Hoseyn and I are as one thing, [as though each were a part of the other,] in respect of the love that is due to us, &c. (Commencement of a tradition in the Jámiʼ eṣ-Ṣagheer: thus explained in the Expos. of El-Munáwee.) See Ḥam, p. 139; and De Sacy's Gr. i. 492.
maA OanaA mano dadK walaA Ald-adu min-iI: see art. dd. IbrD confirms my rendering of this saying.
yataEar-aDu UilaI XaIoCK layosa minohu [He applies himself to a thing not of his business to do]. (TA, art. EX.)
layosa min-aA He is not of our dispositions, nor of our way, course, or manner, of acting, or the like. (TA, art. gX.)
layosa min-iI (Ḳur, ii. 250) He is not of my followers: (Bḍ, Jel:) or he is not at one, or in union, with me. (Bḍ. See 1 in art. TEm.) See a similar usage of mn, voce EiySN.
OanaA minohu kaHaAqini AlUihaAlapi: see HaAqinN

mino is used in the sense of fI in the phrase mino yawomi AljumoEapi [In, or on, the day of congregation] in the Ḳur lxii. 9. (Ḳ, Jel.) So, too, in mino yawomihi In, or on, his, meaning, the same, day: and mino saAEatihi In, or at, his, meaning the same, instant of time. See also De Sacy's Gr., ii. 526.
muna Qll-ehi is for Oayomunu Qll-eh.
man-N: see riTolN.
min-apN [An obligation, EalaI OaHadK upon one, and also lahu to him.]
A favour, or benefit, conferred, or bestowed. (M, Mṣb.)
Also an inf. n. See man-a Ealayohi.
laA OafoEaluhu OuxoraI Almanuwni I will not do it till the end of time. (Ṣ.)
manuwnN is fem. and sing. and pl. (Fr, Ṣ.)
maniynN The first (or main) rope of a well. See karabN.
man-aAnN Very bountiful or beneficent.
Also [Very reproachful for his gifts;] one who gives nothing without reproaching for it and making account of it: an intensive epithet. (TA.)
AimotinaAniI-N Gratuitous; granted as a favour: opposed to wujuwbiI-N.
manojanuwqN, manojanuwnN, minojanuwqN, minojanuwnN, and manojaniyqN: see art. jnq.

1. manaEa He prevented, hindered, held back, [impeded, withheld, arrested, restrained, kept, debarred, precluded, inhibited, forbade, prohibited, interdicted:] (MA, KL, &c.:) he denied, or refused; doubly trans.; (Ṣ, Ḳ, &c.:) manoEN is the contr. of UiEoTaMCN. (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ.)
manaEahu [He protected it, or defended it, or guarded it, (namely a place or the like) from, or against, encroachment, invasion, or attack:] he protected, defended, or guarded, him. (T in art. cb.)
manaEahu AlEaTiy-apu [He refused him the gift]. (TA in art. Hrm.)
manaEahu AlX-aIoCa i. q. Haramahu Uiy-aAhu [q. v.] (Ṣ in art. Hrm.)
manuEa AlX-aIoCu, inf. n. manaAEapN, i. q. AiEotaz-a and taEas-ara. (TA.) See 8.
maA manaEaka Oal-aA tasojuda (Ḳur vii. 11): see OabaI.

3. maAnaEahu AlX-aIoCa He disputed, or contested, with him the thing: (Mṣb:) he refused him the thing: (TḲ:) he endeavoured, or contended with him, to make him, or to entice him, to abstain from, or relinquish, the thing; (TA;) [he endeavoured to turn him away from the thing; to prevent his obtaining it or doing it; he prevented him from obtaining or doing the thing, being also prevented by him; i. e. he reciprocally prevented him,, &c.: and hence the meaning in the TA; and then that in the Mṣb:] maAnaEuwA Eaduw-ahumo signifies i. q. HaAjazuwhumo: (TḲ, art. Hjz:) see the latter.
taman-aEa EalaI Als-anapi [he resisted, or withstood, the year of dearth]: said of an animal. (Ḳ.)
5. taman-aEa mina AlX-aIoCi biq-awomihi and AimotanaEa↓ He became strengthened, or fortified, against the thing by his people, or party; syn. taqaw-aI. (Mṣb.)
taman-aEa Eanohu He refrained, forbore, or abstained, from it, as being forbidden, or prohibited. (Ḳ,* TA.) See 8.
taman-aEa bihi and AimtnE↓ bihi he protected, or defended, himself by it, namely a fortress; syn. AiHotamaI. (TA.)
6. tamaAnaEaA i. q. taHaAjazaA: (Ḳ, art. Hjz:) see the latter.

8. AimotanaEa [It was, or became, prevented from being; it necessarily was not. You say yamotaniEu hecaA liwujuwdi caAka This is prevented from being, or may not be, or necessarily is not, because of that's being. And yamotaniEu Oano takuwan hecaA This may not be.]

AimotanaEa He refrained, forbore, abstained, or held back, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) mina AlOamori from the thing. or affair; (Mṣb;) as also taman-aEa↓ Eanohu: (TA:) he did so voluntarily, of his own free will or choice: he refused: you say, AimotnaEa Eanohu he refrained,, &c., from it voluntarily,, &c.; refused it; or refused to do it. (MF. in art. HSr.) See OabaI.
AimotanaEa Ealayohi He, or it, opposed him; resisted him; withstood him; repugned him; was incompliant, or unyielding, to him; see OabaI Ealayohi.

AimotanaEa It was, or became, inaccessible, or inapproachable; like manuEa↓; syn. with HaSuna, q. v.: and also, difficult of access, as in an instance in art. ObI (last sentence of 4); and also Earisa EalaI-a.
See 5.
manoEapN and minoEapN: see manaEapN.

manaEapN State, and power, of resistance; lit. a state of might of one's people or party, so that such as desires to do so will not prevail against him: [or a state of might in his people or party,, &c.; or a state of might, and power of resistance, in his people or party:] (Mṣb:) [resistibility: or simply resistance:] inaccessibleness, or unapproachableness, of a people; as also manoEapN↓ and minoEapN↓. (TA.)
manuwEN One who denies, or refuses to give; as also maAniEN↓ and man-aAEN↓. (Ḳ.)

maniyEN, from manuEa, [Unapproachable; inaccessible:] difficult of access; fortified; strong: (TḲ, voce wazarN:) [defended, or protected, against attack: like HaSiynN: resistive; resisting attack;] applied to a fortress. (Mṣb.)
qawomN munaEaMCu [pl. of maniyEN] An inaccessible, or unapproachable, people. (TA.)
man-aAEN see manuwEN.
maAniEN see manuwEN.
Almutaman-iEaAni The young she-camel and young she-kid: because they resist the year of dearth by reason of their youthful vigour, &c. (Ḳ.)
1. manaAhu He tried him; proved him. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) You say, manaAhu Qll-ehu biHub-ihaA God tried him by love of her. (T.) And muniIa bikacaA He was tried by such a thing. (T.)
manaI He meditated [a thing in his mind]; syn. qad-ara. (Bḍ, ii. 73.) See Oaminoy-apN.
5. taman-aAhu He wished, or desired, it. (Ḳ, TA.)
Alt-aman-iI relates to that which is possible and to that which is impossible: whereas Alt-araj-iI relates only to what is possible. (I’Aḳ, p. 90.)
10. tusomanonaI, said of a she-camel: see 8 in art. smw.
manFI see maniy-apN.
munoyapN A thing wished for by a man: pl. munFI. (T.) This word and Oumoniy-apN↓ signify the same. (M, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ.) See an ex. in a verse cited voce Oawo
Almunoyapu in the case of a covered she-camel, The period by the end of which one knows whether she be pregnant or not. (M.)
munoyapN of a mare, Twenty days. (M, voce safuwdN.)

maniy-apN [A decreed event. Fate; destiny:] The decree of death: (IB:) or the decreed term [of life, or] of a living being: (Er-Rághib:) death; (Ṣ, M, Ḳ;) because it is decreed; (Ṣ, M;) as also manFI↓: (M, Ḳ:) [properly a thing decreed: and hence the pl.] AlmanaAyaA signifies the fates or decrees [of God]. (T.)
maniy-apN also means † A man of courage upon his saddle: (TA in art. HwI:) pl. manaAyaA: see an ex. voce Hawiy-apN.

Oumoniy-apN An object of wish, or desire: originally, a thing that a man meditates (yuqad-iruhu) in his mind; from manaI signifying qad-ara: and hence applied to a lie; and to what is wished, or desired, and what is read, or desired [pl. OamaAniI-u and OamaAnK]. (Bḍ in ii. 73.) See munobapN and HajowaI.
layosa bihi mahaAhN, (T in art. rmd,) or fiyhi, (L in that art.,) It has no goodness and lastingness. (T and L in that art.)
4. Oamohadato biwaladihaA She (a woman) brought forth, or cast forth, her child with a single impulse. (IAạr, in L, art. xfd.)
Oamohadato biAlwaladi is syn. with Oasohadato bihi; (IAạr, O, TA in art. shd;) and zakabot bihi, &c. (IAạr, L, in art. xfd.)

4. Oamohalahu He acted gently, softly, or in a leisurely manner, towards, or with, him. (Ḳ.) He granted him some delay, or respite; let him alone, or left him, for a while. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) [In both senses] i. q. Oarowadahu. (Ṣ, art. rwd.) You say OamohiloniI Hat-aI OafoEal kacaA Grant thou me some delay that I may do such a thing; give me time to do such a thing. See Ḥar p. 164.
5. tamah-ala He acted, or behaved, deliberately, or leisurely; without haste; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) in an affair. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)
maholN and mahalN↓ and muholapN↓ Gentleness; a leisurely manner of acting or proceeding. (Mṣb, Ḳ, &c.)
maholFA Act gently, softly, or leisurely.
mahalN: see maholN.
muholapN: see maholN.
fiI AlOamori muholapN In the affair is a delay; syn. taOoxiyrN. (Mṣb.)

sense.hi: Leisurely; gently; by little and little.

entry.sense: guromuwlN mutomahil-N A hard penis: see qaAsibN.
mahomapN A far-extending mafaAzap [or desert,, &c.]. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) See UiSomit.
8. Aimotahanahu He used it for service and work: (Ḳ:) i. q. Aibotacalahu, q. v.: (Ṣ, Mṣb:) He held it in mean estimation. (Ḥar, p. 65.)
mahonapN and mihonapN [is syn. with EamalN and fiEolN, and means work, labour, or] service; ministration; performance of an office. (Ṣ, &c.)
Also, The clothes worn in service, or in the performance of business. (Mṣb.)
mahiynN Contemptible; abject: (Ṣ, Ḳ) weak: having little judgment and discrimination. (Ḳ.)
mahowN, applied to a sword, Thin edged: see an ex. voce xaXiybapN.
saloHN mahowN Thin excrement. (Skr in Carm. Huds. p. 15.)
mahFA † Front teeth (vagorN) that are clean, white, and lustrous (having much mMC): so in a verse of El-Aạshà [cited voce raf-a]. (TA.)
mumah-aI Beverage, or wine, (XaraAb,) mixed with much water. (IAạr, in TA, art. Hnc.)
maMCu AlZ-ahori [The seminal fluid]. (Ḳ, voce Ainobat-a.) See Ḳur, lxxxvi. 6, 7, and see 4 in art. rwq.
maMCN Lustre [likened to water, and running water,] of the teeth, (IbrD,), &c.: see ZalomN and darozN and garobN.
maMCN The water of a sword: see firinodN and rawonaqN: also its lustre.
sayofN kaviyru AlmaMCi [A sword much diversified with wavy marks or streaks in its grain; as are the swords of Damascus, &c.] (TA voce UiboriyqN.)
banaAtu AlmaMCi i. q. AlgaraAniyqu. [storks or cranes]. (L, art. wDr.) See EirosN.
Aibonu AlmaMCi is ‡ A kind of bird; pl. banaAtu AlmaMCi; (Mgh in art. bnI:) the aquatic bird; the bird of the water. (Mṣb in art. bnw.)
maMCu AlX-abaAbi: see XabaAbN.
maMCu Alwajohi: see Haqana and taXah-ala.
maMCu Alc-ahabi Gold-wash for gilding: and maMCu AlfiD-api Silverwash for silvering: you say, TalaAhu bimaMCi Alc-ahabi, and AlfiD-api He washed it over with gold, and silver.

maMCN is used as a coll. gen. n., of which the n. un. is maACapN; and therefore is sometimes made, as a pl., to have a pl. epithet: ex. maACN EicaAbN. (See EacobN). maMCapN signifies A water; or some water.

hom.sense: mwqN [Stupidity;] foolishness with lack of understanding. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
A kind of boot: see juromuwqN.

entry.sense: 5. tamaw-ala He became abundant in wealth. (TA, art. vmr).

maAlN Whatever one possesses: (Ḳ:) [property; wealth:] accord. to Moḥammad [the Hanafee Imám], whatever men possess, of dirhems, or deenárs, or gold, or silver, or wheat, or barley, or bread, or beasts, or garments or pieces of cloth, or weapons, or other things: (Mgh:) [property, or wealth:] or originally what one possesses of gold and silver: then applied to anything that one acquires and possesses of substantial things: and mostly applied by the Arabs to camels, because these constitute most of their wealth: (IAth, TA:) and animals. (TA.)

maAlN Camels or sheep or goats. (Ṣ.) The mAl of the people of the desert consists of what are termed naEamN, (T, Mṣb,) i. e. Cattle, consisting of camels or neat or sheep or goats, or all these, or camels alone; (Mṣb in art. nEm;) herds, or flocks, or herds and flocks.
maAlN A square in arithmetic: pl. OamowaAlN. See jacorN.
rajulN maAlN, for cuwmaAlK. (L, art. Syd.)
maAliI-N Of, or relating to, property or wealth.
muwmN [Pleurisy]: see birosaAmN and HumaAmN.
mawaAmiI Lands wherein is nothing: see bal-uwqapN.
2. maw-aha He silvered or gilded, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) or washed over with gold or silver, (Mṣb,) a thing (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA) of brass (TA) or copper or iron. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
He [varnished or] embellished falsehood so as to give it the appearance of truth. (TA.) He falsified information, Ealayohi to him, in reply to a question. (Ḳ.)
He involved in confusion, or doubt; or practised concealment or disguise: or he concealed or disguised: (Ṣ, TA:) and he deceived, deluded, beguiled, circumvented, or outwitted. (TA.)
He varnished, or embellished with a false colouring.

4. OamaAha He (a digger) produced, or fetched out, water, by his labour or work; syn. OanobaTa AlmaMCa: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or reached the water: (Mṣb:) or reached much water; as also OamohaI. (AA, in TA, art. nbT.)

OamaAhu Alr-akiy-apa He (a man) produced, or fetched out, by his labour, or work [in digging,] the water of the well; syn. OanobaTa maMCahaA: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) He (God) made the water of the well to be much, or abundant. (Mṣb.)
maAhapN Small-pox: see MhapN in art. Awh.
maAwiy-apN A mirror; so called in relation to water, because of its clearness, and because images are seen in it as they are in clear water: the m is a radical letter. (T in art. AwI.)
AlmayosaAnu One of the two stars called AlhanoEapu. The other [ξ] is called Alz-ir-u. (El-Ḳazweenee.)
1. maAXa He mixed hair with wool: see Taraqa; and see Freytag's Arab. Prov. ii. 28.
maAXa AlkalAama i. q. TaAraqaha [He practised various modes of speech]. (TA in art. Trq.)
4. AmAEhu He made it to flow. (Mṣb.)
7. AnmAE It flowed. (Mṣb.)
maAYiEN Anything in a melted state, fluid, or liquid: opposed to jaAmidN. (Mṣb.)

mayoEapN Briskness, liveliness, or sprightliness. (Ṣ.) The prime, or first part, of youth, and of the day. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) The first part of the run of a horse: (Ṣ:) the first part, and the briskness, liveliness, or sprightliness, of a run, and of intoxication: or the main part of anything. (TA.)
And The flowing of anything poured out. (TA.)
1. maAla [He, or it, inclined, leant, bent, propended, tended, declined, deviated, or deflected.]
maAla maEahu and maAyalahu↓ He conformed with, and assisted, or aided, him. (TA.)
maAla Uilayohi He loved him. (TA.)
He wronged him. (TA.) He was, or became, inimical to him.
maAlati Ald-aAb-apu mino rijolihaA (Ḳ, art. gmz,) i. q. ZalaEato [It limped]. (TA.)
2. may-ala bayona XayoYayoni He wavered, or vacillated, between two things. (Ṣ, MA.) See 10.
3. maAyalahu He inclined towards him reciprocally: and maAyalaA they two inclined each towards the other. (TḲ, art. hwd.) See also maAla maEahu in 1.
5. tamay-ala See 6.
tamay-ala biAlqawoli He vacillated in the saying: see taraj-aHa.

6. tamaAyala fiI miXoyatihi [He affected an inclining of his body, or a bending, or he inclined his body, or bent, from side to side, in his gait; a meaning well known, and still common]; (Ṣ;) syn. tavan-aI. (Ḥar, p. 269.)
See tazaAyugN.
tamaAyalato fiI miXoyatihaA and tamay-alato↓ signify the same. (TA.)
tamaAyala UilaI AlX-aIoCi; and Eano Tariyqihi: i. q. tajaAnafa [He affected a deviation, or purposely deviated from his course,, &c.] (TA in art. jnf.)
10. AstmAlhu, and AstmAl biqalobihi, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) He inclined him, and his heart. (Ḳ.)
AisotamaAlahu He attracted him to himself; or sought to make him incline. (MA.)
AstmAl is a quasi-pass. of may-alahu↓. (Ḳ,* TA.)
myilN i. q. mulomuwlN, [A style]. (Ḳ.)
mayalN A natural wryness. (Ṣ.)
miylaAni (?) of a maHaAlap of a well: see vinaAyapN.
may-aAlN [i. q. mutamaAyilN, Inclining much]. (A, art. fyd.) See say-aAlN.
Oamoyalu Swaying on horseback: see an ex. of its pl. miylN in a verse cited voce OaXoEala.
Eim-apN mayolaMCu: see qafodaMCu.

AmAlpu AlOalifi The inclining of the sound of A when quiescent, after fet-ḥah, towards the sound of I; so that the fet-ḥah, with that A, composes a sound the same as that of the long “e” in the English word “there.” This is accordant with present usage; and I have not found any learned Arab who asserts otherwise. See also naAbN, and Haj-aAjN, and maXuwbN.
